page.title: 07Farming in 1985 (2)
page.content: Another change is that the{Common {Market}is to drop the beef premium which gave farmers an extra 10% on the value of certain graded carcasses. There may be variable sheep premium. There is the benefit of the market in Europe for cereals. Other new ideas are{growth promoters for beef cattle. {Silage}is used instead of hay, making it easier to feed bigger herds. It is better quality and grass cutting can be done earlier. This has been important this year because we have had so much rain. There is a trend for more{economical {farming}and there may be a quota for grain in the future. There seems to be a general cutting out of smaller farms and family farms and a concentration on large economically run farms. The National Farmers' Union is trying to help small farms.
